Record.Value: Fabrication
Test your knowledge of mining and fabrication.
Practical Training: Stage III
Welcome Cadet. Far from Earth, Stationeers must forge their own resources from local materials. It's time to test your knowledge of mining and fabrication.
Practical Training: Stage III
To finish this part of the base, you need a hydraulic pipebender to create components. But first, you need the raw materials - use your tablet to track them down.
Get tablet from crate.
Practical Training: Stage III
Tablets perform different functions depending on what cartridge is inserted. Add a tracker cartridge
Add tracker cartridge from crate to tablet.
Turn tablet on.
Use the tablet to navigate to the beacon we've placed near an ore deposit.
Navigate to the beacon
Use the drill in your mining belt to mine ore. When the mining belt is equipped, the ore will appear directly in it once mined.
Equip mining drill from mining belt in backpack.
Turn on drill
Mine 30 iron.
Get that ore back to the base and lets get smelting.
Return to the base
Raw ore has to be turned into ingots before it can be used. For that you need an arc furnace. Grab a kit from the crate and place it in the highlighted area.
Get an arc furnace kit from crate.
Place arc furnace in highlighted area.
Connect arc furnace to power.
Now you're ready to smelt iron. Add your iron ore to the arc furnace.
Turn arc furnace on
Add iron ore to arc furnace
Activate arc furnace
Arc furnace produces pure ore ingots, which provide resources for fabrication devices. (Note: We've sped it up for you this time)
Pick up ingot behind arc furnace
Add ingot to autolathe (at side).
To make a hydraulic pipebender, you need copper, iron and gold. Grab other ingots from the crate and add them to the autolathe.
Pick up copper ingot from crate.
Add copper ingot to autolathe.
Pick up gold ingot from crate.
Add gold ingot to autolathe
Use the autolathe to make a pipebender kit
Turn on autolathe.
Select hydraulic pipebender recipe using search function.
Print hydraulic pipebender kit.
Pick hydraulic pipebender kit.
Place hydraulic pipebender in highlighted position
Now that the pipebender's frame is placed, we need to complete it. Just like the autolathe, follow the tooltips to finish construction.
Using resources from the crate, complete pipebender.
Turn on the pipebender.
If you need ingots in a hurry, you can remove them from a machine. Eject ingots from the autolathe by pulling lever, then add them to the hydraulic pipebender.
Pull autolathe lever to eject ingots
Put iron ingot into pipebender
Put copper ingot into pipebender
Put gold ingot into pipebender
In the next stage of testing, you will create an airlock. One of the key components is an active vent. Print an active vent on the hydraulic pipebender.
Select active vent On pipebender.
Fabricate active vent using pipeBender.
Turn off pipebender once fabrication is complete.
Pick up the active vent.
Good work, Cadet. You've built a fabrication system. That's the last step of Practical Testing, Phase III. Press the 'Complete' button to transmit your results to Stationeer Command.
Press transmit button to complete test.
